sentences.sContent: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.sCn: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

sentences.sContent: ...found that what distinguished young adults from children was not the ability to retain facts or apply prior knowledge to a new situation but a quality they called "preparation for future learning"...
...pupils retain more of it over the long term...
...and for us as we retain someone highly qualified...
...in addition to being able to retain key staff with young families...

remMethod.val: re ＋ tain(拿住) → 保留， 保持

words.tran: 保持器；家臣；保持者；[机] 护圈；预付费用

trans.tranOther: to keep something or continue to have something
